summary: A Bureau of Prisons intelligence advisory warning of potential fraudulent legal visitation attempts by individuals posing as attorneys from the 'Las Vegas Defense Group', with specific attempts scheduled for August 15, 2019, at FCC Terre Haute and FCI Sheridan.

events.title: Scheduled fraudulent legal visitation attempts
events.description: Potential fraudulent activity involving individuals claiming to be attorneys attempting to visit inmates at FCC Terre Haute, Indiana and FCI Sheridan, Oregon.

locations: Sacramento Intelligence Unit, Rancho Cordova, CA 95742
keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons issued an advisory about potential fraudulent legal visitation attempts on August 15, 2019.
Individuals posing as attorneys from the 'Las Vegas Defense Group' were attempting to visit inmates at FCC Terre Haute and FCI Sheridan.
Recovered letters with Las Vegas Defense Group letterhead were found not to have actually come from that legitimate organization.
The advisory instructs institutional staff to screen inmate mail carefully and report any correspondence from the Las Vegas Defense Group to their SIS Departments.
This document shows security concerns and potential attempts to contact inmates through fraudulent means shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest.
